oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Neosporosis: Report of the International Neospora Workshop
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Bovine Practitioners, American Association of
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Neospora caninum
abortion
dairy cattle
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Neospora caninum is a protozoan parasite that was mistaken for Toxoplasma gondii until the mid-1980's. Although it was first identified in dogs, neosporosis has recently been recognized as a major cause of abortion in cattle, particularly dairy cattle, worldwide. Full article published in Compendium's Food Animal, Vol 19 ( 4), April 1997
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1997; 164
